Here is a catch all for useful links and resources I come across.  


### Useful Links

* [R Styler](https://styler.r-lib.org/): a package to style your code.
* [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/): A free online textbook written by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund.
* [Mastering R Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/): A free online guide to developing Shiny apps.
* [One Year to Dissertate](https://livefreeordichotomize.com/posts/2018-09-14-one-year-to-dissertate/): Writing your dissertation in RStudio. 
* [Yihui Xie | One Markdown Document, Fourteen Demos](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qLEkUjxk7e8&ab_channel=RStudio): Showing off some of the capabilities available in R Markdown.
* [Building reproducible analytical pipelines with R](https://raps-with-r.dev/): A free online textbook on writting reliable R code by Bruno Rodrigues.
